title:
15f01 - Prevailing wage rates and
fringe benefits.
text:
The D-B require the S/L to
predetermine, as MW, the prevailing wage rates for corresponding classes of
laborers and mechanics employed on projects of a character similar to the
contract work in the area where work is to be performed. Bona fide fringe
benefits are included within the meaning of the terms “wages, scale of wages,
wage rates, minimum wages, and prevailing wages”, as used in the D-B Act. (See
40 U.S.C. § 3141 and 29 CFR § 5.2 (p).)
html: The D-B require the S/L to predetermine, as MW, the prevailing wage rates for corresponding classes of laborers and mechanics employed on projects of a character similar to the contract work in the area where work is to be performed. Bona fide fringe benefits are included within the meaning of the terms “wages, scale of wages, wage rates, minimum wages, and prevailing wages”, as used in the D-B Act. (See 40 U.S.C. § 3141 and 29 CFR § 5.2 (p).)
